alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 23 at 4:23PM CDT until September 23 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern McIntosh County in southeastern Oklahoma... North central Pittsburg County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 515 PM CDT. * At 422 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles west of Raiford, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Eufaula... Crowder... Canadian... Indianola... Hanna... Stidham... Arrowhead State Park... Raiford... Vivian... Vernon... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma near mile marker 245. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows.
